reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I, and another couple just returned from a week in Oahu. We stayed at the Ohana Waikiki Malia, and I was so impressed, that I am doing something I never do, leaving a review. This hotel was suprisingly nice, for the price we paid. It is within walking distance to the beach, and you get free transportation on the Pink Line, with your room key. The staff was unbelievably nice, and friendly. On our last day, our flight did not leave until 9:15 p.m. The staff put our bags in a secure room, after we checked out at noon, so we could go spend our last day at the beach. They even let us use their beach towels. On top of that, they let us use a room when we got back from the beach, to get cleaned up, and change clothes. Very nice. The rooms are small, but very nice. There was even a small balcony on our room. I could her a little bit of noise, later at night, probably as the bars were letting out. We were on the 15th floor, so I would try to get a room up high, or in the rear of the hotel. Even so, we slept very well, and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel is very close to many great places to eat, and shopping. We really enjoyed our stay. The staff though, in my opinion, is what makes this hotel great. Keep up the good work.
reviews.title: Stay at the Ohana Waikiki Malia..you won't regret it!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed at other Ohana hotels in Waikiki, we knew the expectations for this hotel. We wanted a budget hotel in Waikiki so went back to a Ohana hotel. Good deal at $79/night with free perks such as Pink trolley to Ala Moana Shopping Mall, free internet in room and in the lobby, in-room use of safe, and free 15 minute calls back to Mainland. Check in was fast and we were given a high floor with partial ocean view. Fearing the noise from the busy Kuhio street, we requested a room in the back section of the hotel facing Waikiki beach. It was quiet except for one incident of noisy guests returning to their rooms. Room was small, but clean and cozy. We slept well every night with the comfortable king-size bed. Front counter staff was very friendly and helpful. Short walk to BeachWalk shops and restaurants( and of course the beach). We would definitely stay here again if we decide not to have oceanview and beachfront at our doorsteps.
reviews.title: Good location for budget hotel in Waikiki.

reviews.text: This was my second time staying at the Ohana Malia and was just as impressed.
reviews.title: Second Time at the Malia, hoping for a third soon

reviews.text: Hotel is spotlessly clean and staff friendly. The location in Waikiki is perfect, a bit off the main drag but not too far that you can't easily walk to everything. If you plan on sight seeing all the major buses run right past the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Value. Perfect for a family on a budget.

reviews.text: The price is reasonable especially for Waikiki. Would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend it to my friends. The only downside is there is no pool on site. But with the beach a short 10 minute walk away you don't really miss it too much
reviews.title: Great Place/ Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a very pleasant 10 nights here in May. While the hotel does not offer many facilities, you can use the pool & deck at the Ohana Waikiki West, although the beach is not far off. We had requested a room with a king size bed but were advised on checking in that there was none available for the first night but we could be moved the next day by the staff if we would leave our luggage ready to go. The photo only shows part of the room, the closet with the safe and the decent sized, well appointed, bathroom are not in the frame.
reviews.title: Great value.

reviews.text: There is an IHOP restaurant in the building with a Whalers General Store and an ABC store across the street. Staying at an Ohana Hotel gets you free rides on the Pink Line of the Waikiki Trolley, which seems undeservedly very popular. There are many restaurants within a few blocks and shopping areas abound.
reviews.title: We loved our stay and will be back.

reviews.text: The main reason to stay here is that you get more than you pay for. The rooms compare with any you would find at a high-end property but at a relatively bargain rate. Good location, quite close to the beach, our room had been recently refurbished, and pleasant, helpful staff. I would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Room was nice, staff was uninformative

reviews.text: Our hotel room was spacious and clean. The front desk staff was very friendly and hospitable. I loved the view from our hotel balcony. I definitely recommend this hotel. It is very affordable and is in the heart of Waikiki.
reviews.title: Great hotel for the price

reviews.text: The room and hotel was nice. Walking distance from the beach and main street in Waikiki. The front-desk staff did not seem knowledgable or have recommendations about restaurants, activities, etc. In fact, they referred me to the activities desk at the Marriott Courtyard across the street.
reviews.title: confortable hotel, spatious, no luxury

reviews.text: Pros: Staff is friendly. Rooms are clean. Nice to have a fridge to keep drinks cold. Hotel key card gives you free use of the pink line trolley, which is great to go to the zoo and the mall.
reviews.title: Very central location! Parking lot is crazy tight though!

reviews.text: Cons: Parking lot is kind of crazy with steep ramps and tight spots. Parking is expensive at $20 a night. No swimming pool at this hotel, they say you can use the sister hotel swimming pool... but who really wants to walk a few blocks away. Even though there are 4 elevators, they are slow.
reviews.title: Good value, but watch out for a couple of things

reviews.text: Overall, this was a nice hotel for a reasonable price. The rooms are good size and have a nice counter space. Ethernet connection in room was also nice. Breakfast deal is misleading, however. When I booked, I booked the room for two adults and two kids and given the option of $30/day for breakfast which I took. However, when I arrived I was only given breakfast tickets for two and told that's all it was. Breakfast was at the IHOP but you could only order a basic breakfast. So do the math. Also caution to those who think pool is important. The use of the pool is at sister hotels approximately 1/4 mile away -- a long walk for a quick dip.
reviews.title: A good deal for the money

reviews.text: Staff was very helpful and knowledgeable about the hotel and the waikiki area. We got a package deal which included a car rental and access to a Waikiki trolley. Our package also included half off of parking, only $10 per day. The AC worked well and our room had free internet. The room was a little noisy as we could hear the street below, but Waikiki is a busy place.
reviews.title: Excellent choice in Waikiki

reviews.text: I spent an extended weekend at the Ohana Waikiki Malia in November 2010, paying $70 per night plus tax through Priceline.
reviews.title: location is great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were so surprised that our room was so great for under $100! Very clean, lots of room and the staff was helpful and friendly. Great, central location on Waikiki. And having free access to the pink trolley was an added bonus. And parking is only $10 for kamaaina rate instead of $20. Will definitely recommend it to friends.
reviews.title: Excellent,clean,spacious room for the price!

reviews.text: The Malia is a nice little hotel with basic functions for the traveller that doesn't need a lot. It's location is ideal for the The Bus and the Waikiki Trolley and is only a few blocks from the beach. If you are like me and don't spend much time in your hotel, the Malia is a good option. I just needed a place to sleep, wash, and store my clothes that wasn't a total dive. I liked how you needed a key card to get use the elevator. They have a front desk and security men to make their presence known, but that extra bit of security made me feel good - especially since I am a solo female traveler. I was on the 14th floor and the street noise was still pretty loud. I'm the type to find the continuous sounds of the street to be relaxing, but if you need silence, then I'd avoid the city view option.
reviews.title: Functional Place, Nice Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Small complaints:
reviews.title: You will be happy with this hotel

reviews.text: 1. Most of the TV stations were either the 24hr loops of tourist stuff, 24hr news, or in Japanese. That was fine for most of the time, but sometimes I'd want to wind down at night with a good TV show, and I'd have just 3 options on most nights - something on CBS, PBS, and the news. It would have been nice to have more channels.
reviews.title: Front desk staff very friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. The cleaning staff would get to my room at odd times. Sometimes they'd knock as early as 9 and then other times they'd come as late as 2pm. I'd suggest putting your privacy tag on your door whenever you're in there to avoid random knocking when you're sleeping in or just trying to get out of your swimsuit to get ready for a little shopping. Just don't forget to take it off on the way out.
reviews.title: Great service! Great location! Will stay there again!
